commentary: Malinga to Roy, no run that familiar kiss of the ball and round-arm delivery, very full length and a hint of swing, met with a full face on the front foot

commentary: Malinga to Roy, FOUR runs slower ball and tapped very comfortably out through wide mid-on, just waited for the ball to arrive and timed it to perfection with a clip round the front pad

commentary: Malinga to Roy, no run back of a length, nurdled to mid-on

commentary: Malinga to Roy, no run another attempted flick out through the leg side. Can't quite find enough flamingo in his flamboyance to find the gap at midwicket. A decent first over

commentary: Malinga to Roy, FOUR runs too short, and slammed through midwicket! Roy loves that length. Free runs

commentary: Malinga to Roy, FOUR runs Another dipping slower ball, and Roy does very well to adjust late and nurdle through fine leg for back-to-back boundaries
text: Another dipping slower ball, and Roy does very well to adjust late and nurdle through fine leg for back-to-back boundaries

commentary: Pradeep to Bairstow, no run absolutely battered into the covers, but straight at the man. Looked good for the cameras...

commentary: Pradeep to Bairstow, FOUR runs this time he finds the gap, opens the face to create more of an angle, and fillets the gap between point and extra cover. Supreme timing and placement
text: this time he finds the gap, opens the face to create more of an angle, and fillets the gap between point and extra cover. Supreme timing and placement

commentary: Pradeep to Bairstow, no run crunched into the covers once again
text: crunched into the covers once again

commentary: Pradeep to Bairstow, FOUR runs biff! Bairstow is so strong on the drive. No swing on offer, and Bairstow pounds through the covers once more. If he beats the field, it's always four all the way
text: biff! Bairstow is so strong on the drive. No swing on offer, and Bairstow pounds through the covers once more. If he beats the field, it's always four all the way

commentary: Dananjaya to Bairstow, SIX runs pumped up and over wide long-on! He seemed to be sizing up the sweep at first, but the ball just kept coming, right into his slot, and was duly slotted for the first six of the tour!

commentary: Pradeep to Bairstow, OUT a loose drive outside off, and Bairstow walks! No question about the edge, but did it carry? The umpire's finger went up initially, but then he hesitated for confirmation from square leg... Nope... not even a sliver of a doubt! The end of a gallumphing innings from Bairstow, and he's rightly livid ...
text: a loose drive outside off, and Bairstow walks! No question about the edge, but did it carry? The umpire's finger went up initially, but then he hesitated for confirmation from square leg... Nope... not even a sliver of a doubt! The end of a gallumphing innings from Bairstow, and he's rightly livid ...

commentary: Dananjaya to Roy, no run low full toss, pumped to cover
text: low full toss, pumped to cover

commentary: Dananjaya to Roy, OUT oh my word, that's a giveaway from Roy! Picked the offspinner alright, but didn't get close to the pitch of the ball in a flaccid swat through the line, and mid-off backpedals to swallow a simple catch. Two wickets in the blink of an eye, and England's serene start has been derailed
